snippet: The closing of American embassies after an Al Qaeda threat is reasonable, but it is not a long-term solution.
abstract: Editorial contends the closing of nearly two dozen American embassies after security officials intercepted communications from Al Qaeda seems reasonable; calls for long-term solution in which security budgets for diplomatic missions are increased; adds that incident should not be used to justify National Security Agency's unrelated program of domestic surveillance.
lead_paragraph: The closing of American embassies after an Al Qaeda threat is reasonable, but it is not a long-term solution.
